title: Alternate Interior Angles with Parallel Lines
theorem: If two parallel lines are cut by a transversal, then alternate interior angles are equal
given: Lines l and m are parallel. Transversal t intersects l at point A and m at point B.

steps.content: Since l || m, corresponding angles are equal by definition
Angle 1 (on line l, above transversal) equals Angle 2 (on line m, above transversal)
steps.note: Mixing up corresponding and alternate interior angles

steps.content: By vertical angles, Angle 2 equals Angle 3 (on line m, below transversal)
steps.note: This step is correct but builds on incorrect step 2

steps.content: Therefore, Angle 1 equals Angle 3, so alternate interior angles are equal
steps.note: Conclusion follows from flawed reasoning chain
